intro: Trixago rhinanthina, commonly known as the redmaids, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in full sun. Trixago rhinanthina is often used in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
